pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:0.5_0: The training rule on breaking up balls of food
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.13_0: if it is a special curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.14_0: They burn in times of trouble,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.17_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on fifth, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six ate breaking up mouthfuls. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not eat breaking up a ball of food,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.4_0: One should not eat breaking up balls of food.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats breaking up a ball of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
